[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/code/cache/types.rs] [Enum variant: Verified] [Verification freshness] Can verified code become stale if underlying dependencies change, allowing execution of code verified against old framework versions with known vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/code/cache/types.rs] [Type: Arc<D>] [Circular references] Can circular references between Code instances through Arc cause memory leaks, gradually exhausting validator memory over time? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/code/cache/types.rs] [Function: deserialized()] [Reference lifetime] Do references returned by deserialized() have bounded lifetimes, or can they outlive the cache entry leading to use-after-free? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/code/cache/types.rs] [Type: Bytes] [Zero-copy optimization] If Bytes uses zero-copy semantics, can modifications to underlying buffers corrupt cached code, causing non-deterministic execution? (High)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/code/cache/types.rs] [Type: D] [Type parameter bounds] Are there sufficient trait bounds on type parameter D to prevent unsafe or malicious types from being used as deserialized code? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/third_party/move/move-vm/types/src/code/cache/types.rs] [Impl: Clone] [Deep vs shallow copy] Does Clone implementation perform deep or shallow copies, and can shallow copies lead to shared mutable state violating Rust's aliasing rules? (Medium)
